dataset_info.name: 11th Century European Historical Figures
dataset_info.description: Comprehensive dataset of major figures in 11th century Europe for game character system

stats.diplomacy: Diplomatic skill and ability to negotiate (0-100)

characters.name: Henry IV
characters.historical_significance: Central figure in the Investiture Controversy, famously did penance at Canossa (1077)
notable_events: Investiture Controversy with Pope Gregory VII

characters.name: William I
characters.full_title: King of England, Duke of Normandy
characters.historical_significance: Conquered England in 1066, fundamentally changed English history and culture

characters.name: Harold II
characters.historical_significance: Last Anglo-Saxon king of England, died at Battle of Hastings

characters.name: Harald III
characters.historical_significance: One of the last great Viking kings, died attempting to conquer England

characters.name: Gregory VII
characters.historical_significance: Major church reformer, central figure in Investiture Controversy

characters.name: Matilda of Tuscany
characters.historical_significance: Powerful Italian noblewoman, key supporter of papacy against Holy Roman Empire

characters.name: Robert Guiscard
characters.historical_significance: Norman adventurer who conquered much of southern Italy

characters.name: Roger I
characters.historical_significance: Conquered Sicily from Muslims, established multicultural Norman kingdom

characters.name: Rodrigo Díaz de Vivar
characters.historical_significance: Legendary Castilian military leader, symbol of Reconquista
notable_events: Fought for both Christians and Muslims

characters.name: Alfonso VI
characters.full_title: King of León, Castile and Galicia
characters.historical_significance: Major figure in the Reconquista, conquered Toledo (1085)

characters.name: Yusuf ibn Tashfin
characters.historical_significance: Founded Almoravid Empire, defender of Muslim Spain

characters.name: Alexios I Komnenos
characters.historical_significance: Revitalized Byzantine Empire, requested aid leading to First Crusade

characters.name: Anna Komnene
characters.historical_significance: Byzantine historian, wrote the Alexiad chronicling her father's reign

characters.name: Godfrey of Bouillon
characters.full_title: Duke of Lower Lorraine, Advocate of the Holy Sepulchre
characters.historical_significance: Leader of First Crusade, first ruler of Crusader Jerusalem

characters.name: Baldwin I
characters.historical_significance: First King of Jerusalem, consolidated Crusader states

characters.name: Bohemond I
characters.historical_significance: Norman crusader, founded Principality of Antioch

characters.name: Urban II
characters.historical_significance: Called for the First Crusade at Council of Clermont (1095)

characters.name: Philip I
characters.historical_significance: King during Norman Conquest and First Crusade, struggled with vassals

characters.name: William II
characters.historical_significance: Third son of William the Conqueror, died mysteriously in hunting accident

characters.name: Henry I
characters.full_title: King of England, Duke of Normandy
characters.historical_significance: Youngest son of William the Conqueror, strengthened royal administration
notable_events: Seized throne after William Rufus died (1100)

characters.name: Robert II
characters.historical_significance: Eldest son of William the Conqueror, lost Normandy to his brother Henry
notable_events: Battle of Tinchebray - defeated and imprisoned (1106)

characters.name: Malcolm III
characters.historical_significance: Killed Macbeth, married Saint Margaret, modernized Scotland

characters.name: Margaret of Scotland
characters.historical_significance: Saint, reformed Scottish Church, cultural influence on Scotland

characters.name: Sweyn II Estridsson
characters.historical_significance: Restored Danish independence, had at least 19 children (5 became kings)
notable_events: Father of five future Danish kings

characters.name: Canute IV
characters.historical_significance: Saint and martyr, attempted to strengthen royal power, murdered by rebels

characters.name: Olaf III
characters.historical_significance: Peaceful reign, urbanization of Norway, founded cities

characters.name: Vladislaus I
characters.historical_significance: Great warrior king, saint, expanded Hungary, defeated Cumans

characters.name: Vratislaus II
characters.historical_significance: First King of Bohemia, supported Henry IV in Investiture Controversy
notable_events: First to hold title King of Bohemia (1085)

characters.name: Bolesław II
characters.historical_significance: Second King of Poland, murdered Bishop Stanislaus, forced into exile

characters.name: Sancho Ramírez
characters.historical_significance: United Aragon and Navarre, key figure in Reconquista

characters.name: Michael VII Doukas
characters.historical_significance: Weak emperor, economic crisis and debasement of currency
notable_events: Lost much of Asia Minor to Turks

characters.name: Tancred
characters.full_title: Prince of Galilee, Regent of Antioch
characters.historical_significance: Hero of First Crusade, celebrated warrior and crusader

characters.name: Raymond IV
characters.historical_significance: Wealthiest and most powerful leader of First Crusade

characters.name: Anselm of Canterbury
characters.historical_significance: Major theologian and philosopher, Doctor of the Church

characters.name: Peter Abelard
characters.historical_significance: Brilliant philosopher and theologian, tragic romance with Heloise

characters.name: Heloise
characters.historical_significance: Brilliant scholar, tragic romance with Abelard, influential abbess

characters.name: Hildegard of Bingen
characters.historical_significance: Polymath mystic - composer, philosopher, scientist, Doctor of the Church

characters.name: Lanfranc
characters.historical_significance: Reformed English Church, advisor to William the Conqueror

characters.name: Odo of Bayeux
characters.full_title: Bishop of Bayeux, Earl of Kent
characters.historical_significance: Warrior bishop, commissioned Bayeux Tapestry, half-brother of William I

characters.name: Bruno of Cologne
characters.historical_significance: Founded the austere Carthusian monastic order

characters.name: Robert of Molesme
characters.historical_significance: Founded Cîteaux Abbey, beginning of Cistercian Order

characters.name: Omar Khayyám
characters.historical_significance: Great mathematician, astronomer, and poet - author of the Rubaiyat

characters.name: Al-Ghazali
characters.historical_significance: One of most influential Islamic theologians and philosophers
notable_events: Wrote The Incoherence of the Philosophers

characters.name: Malik-Shah I
characters.historical_significance: Seljuk Empire reached its zenith under his rule
notable_events: Expanded Seljuk Empire to greatest extent

characters.name: Nizam al-Mulk
characters.full_title: Grand Vizier of the Seljuk Empire
characters.historical_significance: One of greatest medieval administrators, founded Nizamiyya universities

characters.name: Hassan-i Sabbah
aliases: The Old Man of the Mountain
characters.historical_significance: Founded the Order of Assassins (Nizari Ismailis)

characters.name: Su Shi
characters.historical_significance: One of greatest Chinese poets, also accomplished painter and calligrapher

characters.name: Alp Arslan
characters.historical_significance: Defeated Byzantines at Manzikert (1071), opened Anatolia to Turkish settlement

characters.name: Romanos IV Diogenes
characters.historical_significance: Defeated and captured at Manzikert, Byzantine decline began

characters.name: Ibn Sina
characters.historical_significance: One of most significant physicians and philosophers in history

characters.name: Peter I
characters.historical_significance: Expanded Aragon in Reconquista, captured key territories

characters.name: Constantine the African
characters.historical_significance: Brought Arabic medical knowledge to Europe through translations
notable_events: Translated Arabic medical texts to Latin

characters.name: Gerard of Cremona
characters.historical_significance: Prolific translator, translated over 70 works from Arabic to Latin

characters.name: Hermann of Reichenau
characters.historical_significance: Despite severe physical disabilities, became major scholar and composer
notable_events: Works on astronomy and music theory

characters.name: Guido of Arezzo
characters.historical_significance: Invented modern musical notation, revolutionized music education

characters.name: Peter Damian
characters.historical_significance: Major church reformer, Doctor of the Church

characters.name: Humbert of Silva Candida
characters.historical_significance: Excommunicated Patriarch of Constantinople, caused Great Schism (1054)

characters.name: Michael I Cerularius
characters.historical_significance: Patriarch during Great Schism (1054), split Christianity

characters.name: Leo IX
characters.historical_significance: Major church reformer, pope during Great Schism, canonized

characters.name: Dominic Loricatus
characters.historical_significance: Extreme ascetic hermit, wore chain mail as penance

characters.name: Berengar of Tours
characters.historical_significance: Controversial theologian who questioned transubstantiation

characters.name: Vladimir II Monomakh
characters.historical_significance: Great ruler of Kievan Rus, military leader and writer

characters.name: Sviatopolk II Iziaslavich
characters.historical_significance: Controversial Grand Prince, his death led to Kiev riots
notable_events: Death caused major riots in Kiev

characters.name: Coloman
characters.historical_significance: Learned king, progressive laws including rejection of witch trials

characters.name: Edgar
characters.historical_significance: Peaceful reign, improved relations with England

characters.name: Alexander I
characters.historical_significance: Strengthened Scottish church, fierce warrior

characters.name: Eustace III
characters.historical_significance: First Crusade participant, brother of Godfrey of Bouillon

characters.name: Hugh I
characters.historical_significance: First Crusade leader, brother of King Philip I of France

characters.name: Stephen II
characters.historical_significance: First Crusade participant who fled, returned in shame and died redeeming himself

characters.name: Adela of Normandy
characters.historical_significance: Daughter of William the Conqueror, powerful regent, mother of King Stephen
notable_events: Regent of Blois during husband's crusade
Forced husband to return to crusade
Mother of King Stephen of England

characters.name: Robert II
characters.historical_significance: Prominent First Crusade leader, helped conquer Jerusalem

characters.name: Tostig Godwinson
characters.historical_significance: Brother of Harold Godwinson, allied with Harald Hardrada against England
notable_events: Killed at Battle of Stamford Bridge

characters.name: Gytha Thorkelsdóttir
characters.historical_significance: Wife of Earl Godwin, mother of Harold II, matriarch of powerful family

characters.name: Matilda of Flanders
characters.historical_significance: Queen consort, regent during William's absences, powerful in her own right

characters.name: Roger II
characters.historical_significance: First King of Sicily, created brilliant multicultural court

characters.name: Adelaide del Vasto
characters.full_title: Countess of Sicily, Queen of Jerusalem
characters.historical_significance: Regent of Sicily, briefly Queen of Jerusalem through marriage to Baldwin I
notable_events: Regent of Sicily for Roger II

characters.name: Sichelgaita of Salerno
characters.historical_significance: Warrior duchess, fought alongside husband Robert Guiscard in armor

characters.name: William of Apulia
characters.historical_significance: Chronicler of Norman conquest of Southern Italy

characters.name: Amatus of Montecassino
characters.historical_significance: Chronicler of Norman conquests in southern Italy

characters.name: William of Malmesbury
characters.historical_significance: Greatest English historian of 12th century, chronicled Norman Conquest

characters.name: Orderic Vitalis
characters.historical_significance: Major chronicler of Norman England and Normandy

characters.name: Fulk IV
characters.historical_significance: Count of Anjou, grandfather of Plantagenet kings

characters.name: William Clito
characters.historical_significance: Son of Robert Curthose, rival claimant to Normandy

characters.name: Theobald IV
characters.historical_significance: Powerful count, established Champagne fairs

characters.name: Bertrada of Montfort
characters.historical_significance: Scandalous queen, left husband to marry Philip I causing excommunication

characters.name: Raymond of Burgundy
characters.historical_significance: French noble who married into Leonese royalty, father of Alfonso VII

characters.name: Urraca of León
characters.historical_significance: First ruling queen of León and Castile, turbulent reign
notable_events: Turbulent marriage to Alfonso I of Aragon

characters.name: Teresa of León
characters.historical_significance: Countess of Portugal, established Portuguese independence

characters.name: García II
characters.historical_significance: King of Galicia, deposed and imprisoned by brother Alfonso VI

characters.name: Vitale Michiel I
characters.historical_significance: Doge during First Crusade, expanded Venetian naval power

characters.name: Domenico Selvo
characters.historical_significance: Doge who strengthened Venice's Byzantine alliance

characters.name: Pantaleone di Mauro
characters.historical_significance: Fabulously wealthy merchant, donated bronze doors to Monte Cassino

characters.name: Godric of Finchale
characters.historical_significance: Successful merchant who became hermit saint, first English composer

characters.name: Ahmad ibn Fadlan
characters.historical_significance: Traveler who documented Vikings and Eastern peoples

characters.name: Trotula of Salerno
characters.historical_significance: Female physician at Salerno medical school, expert on women's medicine
notable_events: Wrote medical texts on women's health
One of few female medieval physicians

characters.name: Raimbaut d'Orange
characters.historical_significance: Early troubadour, pioneer of courtly love poetry

characters.name: William IX
characters.historical_significance: First known troubadour, grandfather of Eleanor of Aquitaine

characters.name: Jimena Díaz
characters.historical_significance: Wife of El Cid, defended Valencia after his death

characters.name: Ibn Hazm
characters.historical_significance: Wrote The Ring of the Dove, major Islamic philosopher
notable_events: Wrote The Ring of the Dove (love treatise)

characters.name: Solomon ibn Gabirol
characters.historical_significance: Major Jewish philosopher, influenced both Jewish and Christian thought

characters.name: Rashi
characters.historical_significance: Most influential Jewish commentator, essential for Talmud study

characters.name: Judah Halevi
characters.historical_significance: Greatest Hebrew poet of medieval period, philosopher

characters.name: Moses ibn Ezra
characters.historical_significance: Major Hebrew poet and literary critic of Golden Age

characters.name: Walcher of Malvern
characters.historical_significance: First person to use Arabic astronomical methods in England

characters.name: Adelard of Bath
characters.historical_significance: Brought Arabic science to England, translated Euclid

characters.name: Suger of St-Denis
characters.historical_significance: Regent of France, inventor of Gothic architecture

characters.name: Bernard of Clairvaux
characters.full_title: Abbot and Doctor of the Church
characters.historical_significance: Most influential churchman of 12th century, preached Second Crusade

characters.name: Norbert of Xanten
characters.historical_significance: Founded Premonstratensian Order, reformed church

characters.name: Christina of Markyate
characters.historical_significance: Mystic who refused arranged marriage, became influential prioress

characters.name: Eystein Orre
characters.historical_significance: Commander who died at Stamford Bridge with Harald Hardrada

characters.name: Morcar
characters.historical_significance: Earl who fought at Hastings, later imprisoned by William

characters.name: Edwin
characters.historical_significance: Powerful earl, brother of Morcar, fought against Normans

characters.name: Hereward the Wake
characters.historical_significance: Last Anglo-Saxon resistance leader against Normans

characters.name: William FitzOsbern
characters.historical_significance: William the Conqueror's closest friend and advisor
